document.docAuthor: Xu, Tian, Zeng, Chaoshu & Hutson, Kate S.
document.masterDocTitle: Morphological descriptions of the larval and first juvenile stages of the decorator crab Camposcia retusa (Latreille, 1829) from laboratory-reared material

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Morphological descriptions of the larval and first juvenile stages of the decorator crab Camposcia retusa (Latreille, 1829) from laboratory-reared material

subSubSection.paragraph: Size : RDL = 1.94 ± 0.10 mm ; CL = 1.18 ± 0.09 mm . (Number of examined specimens: 12).

subSection.paragraph: Size : RDL = 2.24 ± 0.06 mm ; CL = 1.42 ± 0.05 mm . (Number of examined specimens: 12).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Camposcia retusa
zoea I: A) lateral view; B) antennule; C) antenna; D) mandible; E) maxillule; F) maxilla; G) maxilliped I; H) maxilliped II; I) maxilliped III; J) pereiopods 1–5; and K) pleon and telson (dorsal view). Scale bars: A, and K: 300 µm; G, H, and J: 150 µm; B, C, D, E, and I: 75 µm; F: 30 µm.

FIGURE 2.
Camposcia retusa
zoea II: A) lateral view; B) antennule; C) antenna; D) mandible; E) maxillule; F) maxilla; G) maxilliped I; H) maxilliped II; I) maxilliped III; J) pereiopods 1–5; and K) pleon and telson (dorsal view). Scale bars: A and K: 300 µm; G, H, I and J: 150 µm; B, C, D, E and F: 75 µm.

subSection.paragraph: Size : CL = 1.45 ± 0.15 mm ; CW = 0.95 ± 0.09 mm . (Number of examined specimens: 8).

Pereiopods ( Fig. 4 A–E). All pereiopods covered with dense simple setae. Cheliped (pereiopod 1) welldeveloped, dactylus bearing three acicular processes; pereiopod 2 with one acicular process on anterior margin of propodus; pereiopod 3 with one small rounded process on anterior margin of carpus; pereiopod 4 has one lateral acicular process on merus; pereiopod 5 has one small process on anterior margin of carpus and one acicular process on anterior margin of merus.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Camposcia retusa
megalopa: A) carapace dorsal view; B) antennule; C) antenna; D) mandible; E) maxillule; F) maxilla; G) maxilliped I; H) maxilliped II; I) maxilliped III. Scale bars: A: 300 µm; B–I: 75 µm.

FIGURE 4.
Camposcia retusa
megalopa: A–E) pereiopods 1–5; F) sternum; G)–J) pleopods 1–5; and K) pleon, telson and uropods (dorsal view). Scale bars: A–E and G–K: 150 µm; F: 300 µm.

FIGURE 5.
Camposcia retusa
first crab: A) carapace dorsal view; b) antennule; C) antenna; D) mandible; E) maxillule; F) maxilla; G) maxilliped I; and H) maxilliped II. Scale bars: A: 300 µm; B, D and F: 75 µm; C, G and H: 150 µm.

FIGURE 6.
Camposcia retusa
first crab: A) maxilliped III; B) sternum; C)–G) pereiopods 1–5; H) pleopods 1–5; and I) pleon and telson (dorsal view). Scale bars: A, H and I: 150 µm; B–G: 300 µm.

subSection.paragraph: Pleopods ( Fig. 4 G–K). Five pairs, present on somites 2–5 of the pleon; endopod of pleopod 1–4 bearing 3–4 cincinnuli each; exopod of pleopod 1–4 with 13–15, 13, 12–13, and 10–11 long plumose natatory setae, respectively; pleopod 5 (i.e. uropod) reduced, segments fused, with 6 plumose natatory setae in terminal end.
Size : CL = 2.05 ± 0.20 mm ; CW = 1.32 ± 0.12 mm . (Number of examined specimens: 5).
Pereiopods ( Fig. 5 C–G). Covered with curved simple setae and hooked setae, both density and length of setae increased compared to megalopa; no process present on segments.
